thread.title: DanielClark published Peaceful show of support for Jeremy Corbyn to be held in Exeter

author: DanielClark
title: DanielClark published Peaceful show of support for Jeremy Corbyn to be held in Exeter
text:
Peaceful show of support for Jeremy Corbyn to be held in Exeter By DanielClark | Posted: June 06, 2017 9 COMMENTS SHARES Peaceful show of support for Jeremy Corbyn to be held in Exeter X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (9) 
A peaceful show of support for Jeremy Corbyn is planned for Exeter city centre on Wednesday. On the day before the General Election, supporters of the Labour Party leader will gather for a peaceful event. 
At least 100 people are confirmed so far to be attending the event which organiser Tasmin Binks says is about projecting a message of positivity, rather than negativity. 
The gathering will take place at the junction of Cathedral Yard and South Street, not on Cathedral Green, a cathedral spokesman said. 
Ms Binks said: “We are organising a peaceful show of support for Jeremy Corbyn tomorrow from 2pm. 
“So far around 100 people have confirmed on Facebook that they will be attending the event. Read more Devon hospital which relies on 98 EU nationals fears Brexit will... 
“The idea is that people will come together in a peaceful, festival style atmosphere. 
“We hope that banners will be made, there will be face-painting stalls, hopefully some speakers will be attending, and we hope to have a general positive atmosphere of support for Jeremy Corbyn rather than a negative atmosphere." 
The event is scheduled to last between 2pm and 5pm, and it comes the day before the General Election. 
The latest YouGov poll suggests that the Conservatives are set to win between 265 and 342 seats, while Labour will win between 230 and 300 seats.
